title: Climate Decision Making and Policy
description: Decision making frameworks for climate policy using Active Inference under deep uncertainty.
learning_objectives: Design climate policies using Active Inference
Handle deep uncertainty in climate decisions

content.overview: Climate decision making involves making policy choices under deep uncertainty about future climate change, socio-economic development, and technological progress. Active Inference provides tools for designing robust, adaptive policies that learn and adjust as new information becomes available.

decision_making_under_deep_uncertainty.multiple_futures: Wide range of possible climate and socio-economic scenarios
decision_making_under_deep_uncertainty.adaptive_strategies: Policies that evolve with new information

robust_decision_making.vulnerability_analysis: Identify key uncertainties and their impacts
robust_decision_making.satisficing: Find policies that meet minimum requirements across scenarios

adaptive_management.monitoring_systems: Continuous observation of climate and policy outcomes
adaptive_management.learning_loops: Update models and policies based on new data

international_climate_cooperation.global_public_goods: Climate as shared resource requiring cooperation
international_climate_cooperation.burden_sharing: Fair distribution of costs and benefits
international_climate_cooperation.active_inference: Countries as agents minimizing national expected free energy

examples.name: Paris Agreement Implementation
examples.active_inference: Countries update contributions based on others' actions

examples.name: Coastal Adaptation Planning
examples.description: Planning for sea level rise in coastal communities
examples.uncertainties: Rate of sea level rise, storm frequency, economic growth
examples.policies: Hard protection, soft adaptation, managed retreat
examples.active_inference: Update plans as new observations arrive

examples.name: Energy Transition
examples.investments: Large upfront costs with uncertain returns
examples.learning: Technology improvement and cost reduction over time
examples.policy: Support policies, carbon pricing, research investment

policy_evaluation.cost_benefit_analysis: Monetize climate impacts and policy costs
policy_evaluation.distributional_impacts: Effects on different groups and regions

stakeholder_engagement.participatory_processes: Include diverse perspectives in decision making

implementation_challenges.political_constraints: Short-term political cycles vs long-term climate goals
implementation_challenges.behavioral_barriers: Resistance to change and policy implementation
